body:
Hi @pgrosu,

Could you please compile `client.cc` using the current head? We just merged #7292, hopefully it could fix this error.

Thanks,
Yuchen

Hi Yuchen,

I'm giving it a try right now, though my system is Linux.

I'll give you an update of the result.

Thank you for helping us,
Paul

Hi Yuchen (@y-zeng),

Unfortunately no luck, I seem to get the same error and had to fix the [core/lib/http/httpcli.c](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/src/core/lib/http/httpcli.c#L206-207) file the same way as before.  Below are the results of the run before my update:

```
D0711 23:44:48.980936531   25414 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:44:48.981324343   25414 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
I0711 23:44:48.981375359   25414 ev_epoll_linux.c:84]        epoll engine will be using signal: 36
D0711 23:44:48.981414350   25414 ev_posix.c:106]             Using polling engine: epoll
D0711 23:44:48.981492984   25414 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:44:48.981547345   25414 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:44:48.981892648   25414 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:44:48.982974762   25414 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:44:49.011128390   25414 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
E0711 23:44:49.160134175   25414 timer.c:181]                assertion failed: deadline.clock_type == g_clock_type
googleapis/test.sh: line 11: 25414 Aborted                 ./client
$
```

I then updateed [core/lib/http/httpcli.c on lines 206-207](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/src/core/lib/http/httpcli.c#L206-207) to the following to update the `clock_type` to `GPR_CLOCK_MONOTONIC`:

``` C++
  }
  req->deadline = gpr_convert_clock_type(req->deadline, GPR_CLOCK_MONOTONIC);
  req->handshaker->handshake(

```

After rebuilding it and running it, I got the expected result:

``` C++
D0711 23:46:25.046384962   25973 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:46:25.046786469   25973 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
I0711 23:46:25.046836612   25973 ev_epoll_linux.c:84]        epoll engine will be using signal: 36
D0711 23:46:25.046873553   25973 ev_posix.c:106]             Using polling engine: epoll
D0711 23:46:25.046952176   25973 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:46:25.047005730   25973 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:46:25.047095087   25973 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:46:25.048337429   25973 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
D0711 23:46:25.050908810   25973 env_linux.c:77]             Warning: insecure environment read function 'getenv' used
The Read ID is: ChZDTXZuaHBLVEZoRHE5ZTJZeTlHLUJnEgIxNxi3tdITKAA
The Fragment Name is: SRR584004.2808039
The Aligned Sequence is: ATCATTACCCCCATTTTACAGAGTGGGAGACTGAAGCACAGTGAAAAGGCTCTGAGAAAGTCGGCTGGCCTAAGTCTCAAGAACAGTCATTCATGGTGGAA

$
```

The good thing is that the BoringSSL library does not need to referenced.  

Feel free to ping me anytime if you need anything.  It would be nice to work together to come up with an elegant solution for this, which I know would help other users as well.

Thanks,
Paul

Hi Paul (@pgrosu),

Thanks a lot for testing this!
If `undefined reference to `SSL_CTX_free'` and `hidden symbol `SSL_CTX_free' is referenced by DSO` do not appear anymore, I'd suggest we close this issue and move back to #7131 to solve `assertion failed: deadline.clock_type == g_clock_type`.

Thanks,
Yuchen

Hi Yuchen (@y-zeng),

I would be happy to :) 

Let's tackle #7131 together - it'll be fun!

Thanks,
Paul
